page.title: 18Skating:recreational pursuit
page.content: The area known as the Fens have always been a noted haven of skaters.In the past, when winter freezes seemed more servere than now, the Fens had large areas of fen and flooded land that froze solid.Even in later years when the Fens were being drained, the long straight drainage canals - or dykes - froze solid. Then skating made a sensible form of progress, and the fen people would skate long distances along these frozen pathways. As most people skated, races were popular. These were both speed races and extremely long distance matches.Whittlesey, the town on the edge of our grid, even gave its name to the forerunner of the modern racing skate - the Whittlesey runner. Today, the ice rink at Peterborough flourishes,but areas of the fens are still used for traditional fen skating
